title: [ENH] Be able to generate prediction intervals for exponential smoothing models
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When you try to run the function `predict_intervals` off an ExponentialSmoothing forecasting object, you get the following error:
"NotImplementedError: ExponentialSmoothing does not have the capability to return prediction intervals. If you think this estimator should have the capability, please open an issue on sktime."

**Describe the solution you'd like**
It seems like statsmodels has two generalized exponential smoothing classes. By generalized I mean that they can contain trends and seasonalities. These are [ETSModel](https://www.statsmodels.org/dev/generated/statsmodels.tsa.exponential_smoothing.ets.ETSModel.html) and [holtswinter.ExponentialSmoothing](https://www.statsmodels.org/dev/generated/statsmodels.tsa.holtwinters.ExponentialSmoothing.html). Sktime currently interfaces holtswinter.ExponentialSmoothing but I think it should try to interface ETSModel instead as it is the more feature-rich version.

As you can see at the end of [this page](https://www.statsmodels.org/dev/examples/notebooks/generated/ets.html), ETSModel can do prediction intervals and simulations.

**Additional context**
This feature request is similar to https://github.com/sktime/sktime/issues/1362
